image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: State governments will be rewarded if they clear away red tape to unlock more modular homes, under a new federal government fund to be announced by Treasurer Jim Chalmers today.

title.children: New $900 million federal housing fund announced for states clearing red tape for modular homes

image.altText: A blue sign saying Queanbeyan District Health Service sits at the entrance to the carpark of a hospital

props.synopsis: An email obtained by the ABC confirms Queanbeyan Hospital has stopped providing surgical terminations for fetal anomalies and medical reasons, restricting access to a legal and time-critical form of reproductive health care.

title.children: Emails shows Queanbeyan Hosptial banned surgical abortions, after woman turned away on day of appointment

image.altText: A man in religious attire stands looking solemnly away from the camera

props.synopsis: The Archbishop had faced calls to resign after a report last week found he had taken insufficient action to stop a person it described as arguably the Church of England's most prolific serial abuser.

title.children: Spiritual leader of Anglicans worldwide Justin Welby resigns after sexual abuse scandal

image.altText: an aerial view of containers

props.synopsis: Multiple rounds of financial stimulus have slowed the pace of China's economic slowdown, but they've failed to help it reverse course.

title.children: Bailing out China's economy has suddenly become more urgent

image.altText: A man on a bike rides through the street with ruins of buildings behind him

props.synopsis: Some 50,000 Russian troops have reportedly moved to a region held by Ukraine since August, with experts saying it is no coincidence that the renewed interest coincides with the US presidential race and the re-election of Donald Trump.

title.children: Ukraine and Russia are fighting over a 'bargaining chip'. It could have implications for Donald Trump's peace plans

image.altText: University students walk through campus, some looking at their phones. The photo is blurry, making faces unidentifiable.

props.synopsis: As the Albanese government moves to ease the debt burden in the HECS system, a different group of former students is demanding their debt be wiped.

title.children: 'Life sentence': The Keating government 'debt trap' Australians are still paying back

image.altText: A stressed-looking woman with short gray hair and maroon top sitting at a table with her head in her hand.

props.synopsis: First results of the 2024 National Carers Survey show many carers feel socially isolated and suffer from high or very high levels of psychological distress.

title.children: 'I've pretty much given up.' Stressed and isolated carers say they can't get the support they need

image.altText: A man in a black suit and a yellow tie stands at a podium, addressing the press and gesturing to the crowd.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is moving aggressively to ready Labor for an early election campaign, flying to Tasmania to announce high-profile candidates for Braddon and Lyons.

title.children: Early election speculation reaches a fever pitch as Albanese announces two candidates in two hours

image.altText: A small child's hand is cupped by an old woman's hand

props.synopsis: One in three Australian grandparents babysit their grandkids to fill in gaps in childcare, becoming a support "village" for working parents, research finds. But what happens if you don't have grandparents to rely on?

title.children: One in three Aussie grandparents regularly babysit to fill in gaps in childcare, research finds

image.altText: A photo of the Shell company logo.

props.synopsis: Oil giant Shell wins a landmark case at The Hague, overturning an earlier court ruling ordering it to cut its carbon emissions by 45 per cent.

title.children: 'We are pleased': Oil giant Shell wins landmark climate case against green groups in Dutch appeal

image.altText: A phone displaying the meta logo sits on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: This year's Shonky Awards have been announced, with Facebook parent company Meta amongst the winners for its "inadequate action" against scams.

title.children: Green juice, Meta and 'grounding' socks: The CHOICE Shonky Award winners released for 2024

image.altText: generic picture of Australian bank notes

props.synopsis: ASIC says the financial loss to members could top $20 million and has launched legal action in the Federal Court seeking penalties and other compliance orders.

title.children: ASIC to take action against Cbus Super over delayed death and disability payments

image.altText: A row of people looking at their phones with one set of hands and phone in focus.

props.synopsis: The federal government wants to create powers to curb the spread of misinformation and outright lies online. But legal experts have detailed why they worry that the proposed laws could actually undermine the truth.

title.children: Scientists at first misunderstood how COVID spread. Under proposed laws, the truth could have been struck from the internet

image.altText: A security person stands guard near a sports center where a man rammed a car into a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Local police describe the hit-and-run incident as a "vicious" and deliberate attack. They say the alleged 62-year-old driver was upset about his divorce.

title.children: 35 killed and 43 others injured in southern China after car deliberately ploughs into crowd

image.altText: A Rex aircraft seen through a window at an airport terminal, in the foreground inside are airport seats.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces a bailout for Rex Airlines, while an ACCC report has revealed domestic airfares have risen since Rex's collapse.

title.children: Coldplay or price gouging? Regulators investigate why Australians are paying more for domestic flights

image.altText: A composite image of the Rainbow Warrior, Rongelap Atoll and a nuclear explosion

props.synopsis: The Rainbow Warrior made headlines around the world when it was sunk by French operatives. But before that, its lesser-known last mission was to evacuate an entire island poisoned by nuclear testing in the Pacific.

title.children: Before this Greenpeace ship was sunk by French intelligence, its last voyage was a rescue mission

image.altText: Superannuation

props.synopsis: The IMF and RBA are worried those risks may end up denting millions of account balances.

title.children: Donald Trump and the one big threat to Australia's almost $4 trillion superannuation system

image.altText: A man and woman leave a building with jackets covering their eyes.

props.synopsis: A mother accused of starving her malnourished daughter has told a Perth court the teenager was "perfect" and had always been thin.

title.children: Malnourished dancer's diet included salad wraps and chocolate, mother accused of starving her tells trial

image.altText: A man dressed in a smoking jacket and sailors hat

props.synopsis: Online influencer Sarnanitha, known as Nitha, has been detained since September after police raided the Flame Massage Spa in Seminyak, and arrested her for being the majority owner.

title.children: Estranged wife of former AFL player Ricky Olarenshaw fails in bid to be released from Bali prison

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a "hacker" superimposed with words like "For Sale, information on citizens, price: $50,000".

props.synopsis: Connor Moucka and John Binns have been arrested in connection to the Snowflake data breaches, which impacted customers of major companies.

title.children: Alleged hackers made only $2.5 million from massive data theft operation

image.altText: Two players reach out and try to grab the ball

props.synopsis: Despite winning two international titles this year, the Australian men's netball team is making more headlines for its dance moves. That's after players copped backlash when a video of them copying Deadpool's NSYNC Bye Bye Bye went viral.

title.children: 'You can't compare it to the haka': Australian men's Fast5 captain hits back at homophobic comments

image.altText: Simone Strobel

props.synopsis: A detective in charge of investigating the death of Simone Strobel, whose body was discovered at a Lismore caravan park in February 2005, has told a coronial inquest it is probable her boyfriend killed her inside a caravan.

title.children: Coronial inquest hears it is 'probable' German backpacker Simone Strobel was killed by then-boyfriend in a caravan

image.altText: Bondi Junction Stabbing Rampage

props.synopsis: Joel Cauchi stabbed and killed six people at the Westfield shopping centre in Sydney's eastern suburbs in April before shot dead by a police officer.

title.children: Police had warnings about Bondi Junction killer's behaviour before mass stabbing, court told

image.altText: Former actor Orpheus Pledger wears a cap and a face mask as he departs from the County Court of Victoria in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Orpheus Pledger, the former Home and Away actor who bashed a woman during a drug-fuelled attack, succeeds in an appeal to reduce his jail sentence.

title.children: Former Home and Away star who bashed woman has jail sentence reduced

image.altText: A man with a China red flag cycling at night.

props.synopsis: What started as college students pedalling to Kaifeng for a taste of nourishing soup dumplings has swelled into a movement, with tens of thousands taking to the streets to ride together through one of China's ancient capitals.

title.children: What started as a craving for soup dumplings has morphed into a night cycling phenomenon — and traffic chaos

image.altText: A wooden cottage with a picket fence

props.synopsis: This house in the South Australian town of Mount Burr sold for $45,000 after the local mill's closure at the turn of the century, but house prices are rising sharply.

title.children: Cute timber cottage sells for 10 times 1999 price as town regains positive outlook

image.altText: Two young nurses in sunglasses hold cardboard posters protesting nurses pay rates

props.synopsis: On the eve of a 24-hour strike, nurses in NSW have lashed out against the state's government refusal to meet its demands for a pay rise, just a day after police received a historic wage increase.

title.children: NSW nurses to strike over low pay, days after police receive a historic wage offer

image.altText: Three large apartment towers.

props.synopsis: Rose Jackson justified her estimate by saying a luxury penthouse in the eastern suburbs is different from a "neat and tidy" flat in Western Sydney.

title.children: NSW housing minister suggests it's possible to rent a two-bedroom flat in Sydney for 'a couple of hundred bucks'

image.altText: A man in a suit looks on, with chin resting on his hand. He is seen from close, with only his head, shoulders and hand visible

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's White House is continuing to take shape, with the US president-elect announcing hardliner Tom Homan will oversee his strict immigration blueprint, among other key appointments.

title.children: Donald Trump announces Stephen Miller, Mike Waltz as cabinet expands

image.altText: Barron Trump and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in a split screen image.

props.synopsis: In the wash-up of the United States presidential election, it is becoming increasingly clear that it is impossible to divide American voters the way pollsters and strategists have in the past.

title.children: Barron Trump and AOC expose the problems with the Democratic campaign

image.altText: Uranus

props.synopsis: A fresh look at data on Uranus from 1986 has prompted NASA scientists to suggest the planet could support life.

title.children: Scientists' beliefs about Uranus proved wrong as data reassessed from a five-day fly-by in 1986

image.altText: Police officers stand near ambulance outside a hotel

props.synopsis: A 53-year-old man has been charged with murder by NSW Police, two days after he was found with the body of a woman inside a Penrith hotel room.

title.children: Man charged with murder after being found in Western Sydney hotel room with body of a woman

image.altText: Night shot of house with glowing flames behind it

props.synopsis: The Freeman siblings escaped the blaze with just the clothes they were wearing after feeling the heat and smelling smoke from the cabin next door.

title.children: Family of five left homeless after fire rips through affordable housing complex

image.altText: Shark bites a seal shaped decoy

props.synopsis: Researchers believe their work could mean a "revolution" in surfboard design that is potentially beneficial here in Australia.

title.children: LED lighting on surfboards may deter great white sharks from attacking surfers
